CreateWorkspaces.documentation:
Creates one or more WorkSpaces.

  This operation is asynchronous and returns before the WorkSpaces are created.

DescribeWorkspaceBundles.documentation:
Obtains information about the WorkSpace bundles that are available to your account in the specified region.

 You can filter the results with either the ``BundleIds`` parameter, or the ``Owner`` parameter, but not both.

 This operation supports pagination with the use of the ``NextToken`` request and response parameters. If more results are available, the ``NextToken`` response member contains a token that you pass in the next call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items.

DescribeWorkspaceDirectories.documentation:
Retrieves information about the AWS Directory Service directories in the region that are registered with Amazon WorkSpaces and are available to your account.

 This operation supports pagination with the use of the ``NextToken`` request and response parameters. If more results are available, the ``NextToken`` response member contains a token that you pass in the next call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items.

DescribeWorkspaces.documentation:
Obtains information about the specified WorkSpaces. 

 Only one of the filter parameters, such as ``BundleId``, ``DirectoryId``, or ``WorkspaceIds``, can be specified at a time.

 This operation supports pagination with the use of the ``NextToken`` request and response parameters. If more results are available, the ``NextToken`` response member contains a token that you pass in the next call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items.

RebootWorkspaces.documentation:
Reboots the specified WorkSpaces.

 To be able to reboot a WorkSpace, the WorkSpace must have a **State** of ``AVAILABLE``, ``IMPAIRED``, or ``INOPERABLE``.

  This operation is asynchronous and will return before the WorkSpaces have rebooted.

RebuildWorkspaces.documentation:
Rebuilds the specified WorkSpaces.

 Rebuilding a WorkSpace is a potentially destructive action that can result in the loss of data. Rebuilding a WorkSpace causes the following to occur:

 

  * The system is restored to the image of the bundle that the WorkSpace is created from. Any applications that have been installed, or system settings that have been made since the WorkSpace was created will be lost.
  * The data drive (D drive) is re-created from the last automatic snapshot taken of the data drive. The current contents of the data drive are overwritten. Automatic snapshots of the data drive are taken every 12 hours, so the snapshot can be as much as 12 hours old.
 
 To be able to rebuild a WorkSpace, the WorkSpace must have a **State** of ``AVAILABLE`` or ``ERROR``.

  This operation is asynchronous and will return before the WorkSpaces have been completely rebuilt.

TerminateWorkspaces.documentation:
Terminates the specified WorkSpaces.

 Terminating a WorkSpace is a permanent action and cannot be undone. The user's data is not maintained and will be destroyed. If you need to archive any user data, contact Amazon Web Services before terminating the WorkSpace.

 You can terminate a WorkSpace that is in any state except ``SUSPENDED``.

  This operation is asynchronous and will return before the WorkSpaces have been completely terminated.

ComputeType.documentation: Contains information about the compute type of a WorkSpace bundle.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the compute type for the bundle.

CreateWorkspacesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the CreateWorkspaces operation.

members.name: Workspaces
members.documentation: An array of structures that specify the WorkSpaces to create.

CreateWorkspacesResult.documentation: Contains the result of the CreateWorkspaces operation.

members.name: FailedRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that represent the WorkSpaces that could not be created.

members.name: PendingRequests
members.documentation:
An array of structures that represent the WorkSpaces that were created.

Because this operation is asynchronous, the identifier in WorkspaceId is not immediately available. If you immediately call DescribeWorkspaces with this identifier, no information will be returned.

members.name: EnableWorkDocs
members.documentation: Specifies if the directory is enabled for Amazon WorkDocs.

members.name: EnableInternetAccess
members.documentation: A public IP address will be attached to all WorkSpaces that are created or rebuilt.

members.name: DefaultOu
members.documentation: The organizational unit (OU) in the directory that the WorkSpace machine accounts are placed in.

members.name: CustomSecurityGroupId
members.documentation: The identifier of any custom security groups that are applied to the WorkSpaces when they are created.

members.name: UserEnabledAsLocalAdministrator
members.documentation: The WorkSpace user is an administrator on the WorkSpace.

DescribeWorkspaceBundlesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DescribeWorkspaceBundles operation.

members.name: BundleIds
members.documentation: An array of strings that contains the identifiers of the bundles to retrieve. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter parameter.

members.name: Owner
members.documentation:
The owner of the bundles to retrieve. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter parameter.

This contains one of the following values:

  • null - Retrieves the bundles that belong to the account making the call.
  • AMAZON - Retrieves the bundles that are provided by AWS.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The NextToken value from a previous call to this operation. Pass null if this is the first call.

DescribeWorkspaceBundlesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DescribeWorkspaceBundles operation.

members.name: Bundles
members.documentation: An array of structures that contain information about the bundles.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items. This token is valid for one day and must be used within that timeframe.

DescribeWorkspaceDirectoriesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DescribeWorkspaceDirectories operation.

members.name: DirectoryIds
members.documentation: An array of strings that contains the directory identifiers to retrieve information for. If this member is null, all directories are retrieved.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The NextToken value from a previous call to this operation. Pass null if this is the first call.

DescribeWorkspaceDirectoriesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the DescribeWorkspaceDirectories operation.

members.name: Directories
members.documentation: An array of structures that contain information about the directories.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items. This token is valid for one day and must be used within that timeframe.

DescribeWorkspacesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the DescribeWorkspaces operation.

members.name: WorkspaceIds
members.documentation:
An array of strings that contain the identifiers of the WorkSpaces for which to retrieve information. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter parameter.

Because the CreateWorkspaces operation is asynchronous, the identifier returned by CreateWorkspaces is not immediately available. If you immediately call DescribeWorkspaces with this identifier, no information will be returned.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: Specifies the directory identifier to which to limit the WorkSpaces. Optionally, you can specify a specific directory user with the UserName parameter. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter parameter.

members.name: UserName
members.documentation: Used with the DirectoryId parameter to specify the directory user for which to obtain the WorkSpace.

members.name: BundleId
members.documentation: The identifier of a bundle to obtain the WorkSpaces for. All WorkSpaces that are created from this bundle will be retrieved. This parameter cannot be combined with any other filter parameter.

members.name: Limit
members.documentation: The maximum number of items to return.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: The NextToken value from a previous call to this operation. Pass null if this is the first call.

DescribeWorkspacesResult.documentation: Contains the results for the DescribeWorkspaces operation.

members.name: Workspaces
members.documentation:
An array of structures that contain the information about the WorkSpaces.

Because the CreateWorkspaces operation is asynchronous, some of this information may be incomplete for a newly-created WorkSpace.

members.name: NextToken
members.documentation: If not null, more results are available. Pass this value for the NextToken parameter in a subsequent call to this operation to retrieve the next set of items. This token is valid for one day and must be used within that timeframe.

FailedCreateWorkspaceRequest.documentation: Contains information about a WorkSpace that could not be created.

members.name: WorkspaceRequest
members.documentation: A WorkspaceRequest object that contains the information about the WorkSpace that could not be created.

members.name: ErrorCode
members.documentation: The error code.

members.name: ErrorMessage
members.documentation: The textual error message.

FailedWorkspaceChangeRequest.documentation: Contains information about a WorkSpace that could not be rebooted (RebootWorkspaces), rebuilt (RebuildWorkspaces), or terminated (TerminateWorkspaces).

members.name: WorkspaceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the WorkSpace.

members.name: ErrorCode
members.documentation: The error code.

members.name: ErrorMessage
members.documentation: The textual error message.

InvalidParameterValuesException.documentation: One or more parameter values are not valid.

members.name: message
members.documentation: The exception error message.

RebootRequest.documentation: Contains information used with the RebootWorkspaces operation to reboot a WorkSpace.

members.name: WorkspaceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the WorkSpace to reboot.

RebootWorkspacesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the RebootWorkspaces operation.

members.name: RebootWorkspaceRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that specify the WorkSpaces to reboot.

RebootWorkspacesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the RebootWorkspaces operation.

members.name: FailedRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that represent any WorkSpaces that could not be rebooted.

RebuildRequest.documentation: Contains information used with the RebuildWorkspaces operation to rebuild a WorkSpace.

members.name: WorkspaceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the WorkSpace to rebuild.

RebuildWorkspacesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the RebuildWorkspaces operation.

members.name: RebuildWorkspaceRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that specify the WorkSpaces to rebuild.

RebuildWorkspacesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the RebuildWorkspaces operation.

members.name: FailedRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that represent any WorkSpaces that could not be rebuilt.

ResourceLimitExceededException.documentation: Your resource limits have been exceeded.

members.name: message
members.documentation: The exception error message.

ResourceUnavailableException.documentation: The specified resource is not available.

members.name: message
members.documentation: The exception error message.

members.name: ResourceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the resource that is not available.

TerminateRequest.documentation: Contains information used with the TerminateWorkspaces operation to terminate a WorkSpace.

members.name: WorkspaceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the WorkSpace to terminate.

TerminateWorkspacesRequest.documentation: Contains the inputs for the TerminateWorkspaces operation.

members.name: TerminateWorkspaceRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that specify the WorkSpaces to terminate.

TerminateWorkspacesResult.documentation: Contains the results of the TerminateWorkspaces operation.

members.name: FailedRequests
members.documentation: An array of structures that represent any WorkSpaces that could not be terminated.

UserStorage.documentation: Contains information about the user storage for a WorkSpace bundle.

members.name: Capacity
members.documentation: The amount of user storage for the bundle.

members.name: WorkspaceId
members.documentation: The identifier of the WorkSpace.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the AWS Directory Service directory that the WorkSpace belongs to.

members.name: UserName
members.documentation: The user that the WorkSpace is assigned to.

members.name: IpAddress
members.documentation: The IP address of the WorkSpace.

members.name: State
members.documentation: The operational state of the WorkSpace.

members.name: BundleId
members.documentation: The identifier of the bundle that the WorkSpace was created from.

members.name: SubnetId
members.documentation: The identifier of the subnet that the WorkSpace is in.

members.name: ErrorMessage
members.documentation: If the WorkSpace could not be created, this contains a textual error message that describes the failure.

members.name: ErrorCode
members.documentation: If the WorkSpace could not be created, this contains the error code.

WorkspaceBundle.documentation: Contains information about a WorkSpace bundle.

members.name: BundleId
members.documentation: The bundle identifier.

members.name: Name
members.documentation: The name of the bundle.

members.name: Owner
members.documentation: The owner of the bundle. This contains the owner's account identifier, or AMAZON if the bundle is provided by AWS.

members.name: Description
members.documentation: The bundle description.

members.name: UserStorage
members.documentation: A UserStorage object that specifies the amount of user storage that the bundle contains.

members.name: ComputeType
members.documentation: A ComputeType object that specifies the compute type for the bundle.

WorkspaceDirectory.documentation: Contains information about an AWS Directory Service directory for use with Amazon WorkSpaces.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The directory identifier.

members.name: Alias
members.documentation: The directory alias.

members.name: DirectoryName
members.documentation: The name of the directory.

members.name: RegistrationCode
members.documentation: The registration code for the directory. This is the code that users enter in their Amazon WorkSpaces client application to connect to the directory.

members.name: SubnetIds
members.documentation: An array of strings that contains the identifiers of the subnets used with the directory.

members.name: DnsIpAddresses
members.documentation: An array of strings that contains the IP addresses of the DNS servers for the directory.

members.name: CustomerUserName
members.documentation: The user name for the service account.

members.name: IamRoleId
members.documentation: The identifier of the IAM role. This is the role that allows Amazon WorkSpaces to make calls to other services, such as Amazon EC2, on your behalf.

members.name: DirectoryType
members.documentation: The directory type.

members.name: WorkspaceSecurityGroupId
members.documentation: The identifier of the security group that is assigned to new WorkSpaces.

members.name: State
members.documentation: The state of the directory's registration with Amazon WorkSpaces

members.name: WorkspaceCreationProperties
members.documentation: A structure that specifies the default creation properties for all WorkSpaces in the directory.

WorkspaceRequest.documentation: Contains information about a WorkSpace creation request.

members.name: DirectoryId
members.documentation: The identifier of the AWS Directory Service directory to create the WorkSpace in. You can use the DescribeWorkspaceDirectories operation to obtain a list of the directories that are available.

members.name: UserName
members.documentation: The username that the WorkSpace is assigned to. This username must exist in the AWS Directory Service directory specified by the DirectoryId member.

members.name: BundleId
members.documentation: The identifier of the bundle to create the WorkSpace from. You can use the DescribeWorkspaceBundles operation to obtain a list of the bundles that are available.
